title: Walter Greenlands
text:
Walter John Greenlands (1899–1958) was an Australian <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> player who played in the 1920s and 1930s.
Playing career.
Greenlands played two seasons for <a href="St.%20George%20Dragons">St. George</a> between 1929 and 1930. The highlight of his career was when he played in <a href="St%20George%20Dragons">St George's</a> <a href="1930%20NSWRFL%20season">1930 Grand Final</a> loss to <a href="Western%20Suburbs%20Magpies">Western Suburbs</a>.
Death.
Greenlands died in <a href="Corrimal%2C%20New%20South%20Wales">Corrimal, New South Wales</a> on 23 February 1958, aged 58.
